BITCOIN TESTS SHORT-TERM PAIN THRESHOLD AT $90,950

Bitcoin remains stuck below $90K, with short-term holders sitting on unrealized losses.

Historically, BTC trading beneath their cost basis signals potential downside pressure; current price action suggests weak hands may exit before stability returns.

Some short-term buyers are still accumulating‚Äîbut the risk of further corrections lingers.

Seasoned investors are watching $90,950 as the key level for sustained upside.

Source: NewsBTC

result.text:
TEXAS SENATE ADVANCES STATE-OWNED BITCOIN STRATEGY

The Texas Senate Banking Committee has cleared SB-21, a bill that could make Bitcoin a state reserve asset.

The bill authorizes the Texas Comptroller to manage BTC and other digital assets‚Äîciting inflation protection and financial resilience.

Legislators across the U.S. are considering similar measures: Oklahoma, Arizona, and Utah are pushing forward, while others have rejected the idea.

With state-backed Bitcoin adoption gaining traction, institutional accumulation may follow.

Source: CryptoSlate

BITCOIN GOES MAINSTREAM AS US BUILDS STRATEGIC RESERVE

Trump just signed off on a Bitcoin Strategic Reserve‚Äîfinally bringing BTC into the heart of the US financial system.

Instead of buying fresh Bitcoin, the reserve kicks off with seized crypto‚Äîmaking it a calculated power play without upfront cost.

The market didn‚Äôt love it‚ÄîBTC dropped 6% on the reveal‚Äîbut big picture, Bitcoin is now being treated like a serious global asset; expect new BTC-backed financial products, lending tools, and alternative payment rails to follow.

Make no mistake: history is being written.

Source: Cointelegraph

BITCOIN REJECTED AS MACRO RISKS STACK UP

Bitcoin's $82K dream just hit a wall‚Äîgold holds firm while BTC tanks $10K overnight.

Trade war tensions, stock sell-offs, and oil price drops are fueling a global risk-off pivot.

BTC now mirrors risk assets instead of hedging against them, slipping toward a key bull market support level; Gold is outperforming Bitcoin YTD‚Äîa stark reversal from last year's trend.

The White House Crypto Summit looms, but the market‚Äôs already making its move.

Source: Cointelegraph

result.text:
The recent crypto market volatility shows that no bull run is linear.

While some may have been rattled by Bitcoin‚Äôs >20% drawdown to $78K last week, historical cycles show that such corrections are par for the course. 

Looking back at $BTC‚Äôs 2017 and 2021 bull runs, multiple pullbacks of 25% or more occurred before new highs were reached.

This time, however, macro forces and regulatory uncertainties add an extra layer of complexity.

‚ó¢ Market Resilience Amid Bybit‚Äôs Hack & Broader Sell-Off

Despite the backdrop of Bybit‚Äôs security breach, which saw an estimated $25M drained from user accounts, the market remained relatively resilient.

In past cycles, major exchange hacks (such as Mt. Gox in 2014 or Binance‚Äôs $40M $BTC hack in 2019) led to prolonged periods of uncertainty. This time, the rapid recovery suggests that market structure has evolved, with deeper liquidity, better risk management, and a more mature investor base.

However, the real test of resilience came from Bitcoin‚Äôs sharp correction. The drop below $80K wiped out excessive leverage, evidenced by over $800M in liquidations across long positions. 

These shakeouts are necessary to reset market positioning and reduce the frothiness that had been building up. Open interest in $BTC futures dropped significantly, signaling a cooling-off period, but funding rates have stabilized, suggesting that speculative excess has been flushed out, maybe for now.

‚ó¢ Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄúUS Crypto Strategic Reserve‚Äù

Over the weekend, the market got a lifeline of optimism after Trump‚Äôs unexpected announcement to establish a "Crypto Strategic Reserve" featuring $BTC, $ETH, $SOL, $XRP, and $ADA.

The News initially sparked a short-lived rally, but prices have since retraced, with $BTC, $ETH, and $SOL returning to pre-announcement levels.

The lack of clarity on why these assets were chosen or what the reserve's purpose is kinda fishy tho. Like, why did they include $XRP and $ADA, and leave out other major players like $BNB or $TRON? 

While regulatory clarity and political support could be long-term catalysts, traders should be more focused on near-term price action.

Market‚Äôs failure to sustain gains post-announcement highlights a key theme: bullish news isn‚Äôt enough to sustain momentum if macro headwinds and liquidity conditions don‚Äôt support it.

‚ó¢ Key Levels & Macro Catalysts To Watch

With $BTC still hovering below key resistance levels, what comes next?

> Short-term

$BTC needs to reclaim $85K-$90K to re-establish momentum, with $80K as strong support. 

Funding rates remain neutral, suggesting neither excessive bullish nor bearish positioning.

> Macro Forces

The upcoming FOMC meeting and CPI print will be crucial in determining risk appetite. 

If inflation remains sticky, rate-cut expectations may shift, impacting liquidity flows into crypto.

> ETF Flows

Spot Bitcoin ETF inflows have slowed, with outflows from GBTC offsetting demand. However, if institutional buying picks up, it could provide a strong bid for $BTC.

‚úçÔ∏è My Take

For now, the focus should be on whether $BTC can reclaim key levels and whether institutional flows return in strength. 

While short-term volatility is inevitable, the long-term bull case remains intact, so long as the structural demand drivers (ETF flows, institutional adoption, and macro trends) continue to evolve in crypto‚Äôs favor.

result.text:
Donald Trump signs order for Strategic Bitcoin Reserve & Digital Asset Stockpile ahead of White House Crypto Summit.

Here's what good for @Stacks.

1. Bitcoin still remains the dominant asset. Bitcoin must flow. Bitcoin L2 narrative is strong.
2. Attendees of the summit have unique strong ties with Stacks, thanks to our ecosystem's business development working group.

a. Anchorage Digital CEO confirmed to attend today.

‚ÄúLayer 2s like Stacks are advancing a new vision for the Bitcoin ecosystem‚Äîand institutions are taking notice. As the crypto ecosystem continues to expand, we are committed to providing safe, secure, and regulated access to innovative networks like Stacks. We‚Äôre pleased to offer access to qualified custody for Stacks via Anchorage Digital Bank N.A.‚Äù

‚Äî Nathan McCauley, CEO and Co-Founder of Anchorage Digital

b. Crypto. com CEO confirmed to attend.

The Stacks BD working group holds great relationships with crypto. com. STX is the only listed asset that allows you to natively earn BTC via Crypto. com.

c. Coinbase CEO confirmed to attend.

STX recently got listed in the state of New York, historically a very strict regulatory playing field for crypto. Stacks is the only available Bitcoin L2 on Coinbase worldwide. Stacks is part of the Coinbase COIN50 INDEX at #29.

d. David Sacks, AI & Crypto Czar of the White House

Has shown interest in Stacks.

Multiple other attendees have been favorable and open to Stacks as the leading Bitcoin L2.

Will this lead to STX being part of the Digital Asset Stockpile? Most likely not, as this will be created from the current assets already in possession of the U.S. However, Stacks is still positioned as a leader in making Bitcoin a productive asset.

MT. GOX TRANSFERS $1B BTC, PRESSURE BUILDS

Mt. Gox just moved over $1 billion in Bitcoin‚Äîits first major transaction in three months; 11,834 BTC shifted to a new address, reigniting debate over whether this signals imminent sales or just creditor logistics.

The exchange still holds 36,000 BTC, valued at $3.3B; reimbursements have been slow‚Äîwith final payouts now pushed to October 2025.

Whether this move fuels market volatility depends on what happens next.

Source: CryptoSlate

result.text:
SWISS NATIONAL BANK REJECTS BITCOIN BACKING

The Swiss National Bank has dismissed Bitcoin as a reserve asset‚Äîciting volatility, liquidity constraints, and security risks. 

President Martin Schlegel argues that BTC doesn‚Äôt meet the stability required for central bank reserves and questions its relevance in global finance.

Meanwhile, a grassroots initiative is working to force the issue onto a national vote.

Even in Switzerland, Bitcoin‚Äôs path to institutional adoption faces an uphill climb.

Source: Bitcoin.comNews
